Want to help build and improve our website? We're looking for developers, designers, writers, and community members to collaborate on this open project!

# Join the Flamingalo Website Team! ğŸ¦©ğŸ”¥

Hey Flamingalers! ğŸ‘‹

We're looking for community members who want to help build and improve our official website. Whether you're a developer, designer, writer, or just passionate about making Flamingalo better, we'd love to have you on board!

## ğŸ¨ How You Can Contribute

### For Developers
- Improve existing features and functionality
- Add new interactive elements
- Fix bugs and optimize performance
- Review code and suggest improvements
- Help with responsive design and accessibility

### For Content Creators
- Write blog posts about Flamingalo experiences
- Create guides and tutorials for participants
- Translate content to other languages
- Document community stories and memories
- Share photos and visual content

### For Designers
- Improve UI/UX across the site
- Create graphics and illustrations
- Design new sections and pages
- Enhance visual consistency
- Work on branding elements

### For Everyone
- Report bugs and issues you find
- Suggest new features and improvements
- Test the website on different devices
- Share feedback from the community
- Help organize content and information

## ğŸš€ Our Tech Stack

The Flamingalo website is built with modern, performant technologies:

- **Astro 5** - Lightning-fast static site generation
- **React 19** - Interactive UI components
- **TypeScript** - Type-safe development
- **Tailwind CSS 4** - Modern styling
- **Markdown** - Easy content creation for blog posts

Don't worry if you're not familiar with all of these - we're here to help you learn!

## ğŸ’¬ How to Get Started

### Step 1: Join Our Community

The first step is to join our **Telegram community** where all the magic happens!

ğŸ‘‰ **[Join Flamingalo 2025 Telegram](https://t.me/+8rF8c-tPM9c5MGU0)**

### Step 2: Find the Website Team

Once you're in the Telegram group:
1. Introduce yourself and mention you want to help with the website
2. Look for people already involved in the website project
3. Ask about current needs and how you can contribute
4. The ORG team will connect you with the right people

### Step 3: Start Contributing

No coding experience? **No problem!** We need:
- âœ… Writers for blog posts
- âœ… Translators for multiple languages
- âœ… Testers to find bugs
- âœ… Community members to provide feedback
- âœ… Anyone with ideas to share!

Have coding skills? **Awesome!** We need:
- âœ… Frontend developers
- âœ… UI/UX designers
- âœ… Accessibility experts
- âœ… Performance optimization help

## ğŸŒŸ Why Contribute?

### It's a Co-Created Event

Flamingalo is built by the community, for the community. The website is no different! This is your chance to be part of something bigger and help shape the digital home of our amazing event.

### Learn and Grow

Working on an open project like this is a fantastic way to:
- Learn new technologies
- Collaborate with talented people
- Build your portfolio
- Make real impact

### Embody the 10 Principles

Contributing to the website embodies several of the Burning Man principles:
- **Participation** - Be part of creating, not just consuming
- **Communal Effort** - Work together to build something amazing
- **Gifting** - Share your skills and time with the community
- **Civic Responsibility** - Help maintain our digital infrastructure

## ğŸ“‹ Current Projects and Needs

Here are some areas where we especially need help:

### Content
- Blog posts about past Flamingalo experiences
- Guides for first-time participants
- Information about art installations
- Workshop and camp descriptions
- Translation to Portuguese and other languages

### Development
- Mobile responsiveness improvements
- Performance optimization
- Accessibility enhancements
- New interactive features
- Bug fixes and testing

### Design
- Graphics for blog posts
- Illustrations for guides
- Visual elements for different sections
- Social media graphics
- Print materials

## ğŸ¤ Collaboration Spirit

Remember, we follow the **10 Principles of Burning Man**. When contributing:
- Be respectful and inclusive
- Share knowledge freely
- Give and receive feedback gracefully
- Collaborate, don't compete
- Have fun and be creative!

## ğŸ“ Questions?

Have questions about contributing? Need technical help getting started? Want to pitch an idea?

**Join the Telegram group and reach out!** The community is friendly, welcoming, and always happy to help newcomers get involved.
